pénale.

mecánico, incluidos los sistemas de almacenamiento y recuperación de información, sin la previa autorización por escrito del IB. Además, la

que incluye, a título enunciativo, editoriales, profesores particulares, servicios de apoyo académico o ayuda para el estudio, colegios

mediante plataformas digitales—, ya sea incluido en tasas o no, está prohibido y constituye un delito.

                                                                           –3–                                           N22/4/PHYSI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


Subject Details: Physics HL Paper 2 Markscheme

Mark Allocation
Candidates are required to answer ALL questions. Maximum total = [90 marks].

1.     Each row in the “Question” column relates to the smallest subpart of the question.
2.     The maximum mark for each question subpart is indicated in the “Total” column.
3.     Each marking point in the “Answers” column is shown by means of a tick (✔) at the end of the marking point.
4.     A question subpart may have more marking points than the total allows. This will be indicated by “max” written after the mark in the “Total” column.
      The related rubric, if necessary, will be outlined in the “Notes” column.
5.     An alternative wording is indicated in the “Answers” column by a slash (/). Either wording can be accepted.
6.     An alternative answer is indicated in the “Answers” column by “OR” between the alternatives. Either answer can be accepted.
7.     Words in angled brackets « » in the “Answers” column are not necessary to gain the mark.
8.    Words that are underlined are essential for the mark.
9.    The order of marking points does not have to be as in the “Answers” column, unless stated otherwise in the “Notes” column.
10.   If the candidate’s answer has the same “meaning” or can be clearly interpreted as being of equivalent significance, detail and validity as
      that in the “Answers” column then award the mark. Where this point is considered to be particularly relevant in a question it is emphasized by
      OWTTE (or words to that effect) in the “Notes” column.
11.   Remember that many candidates are writing in a second language. Effective communication is more important than grammatical accuracy.
12.   Occasionally, a part of a question may require an answer that is required for subsequent marking points. If an error is made in the first
      marking point then it should be penalized. However, if the incorrect answer is used correctly in subsequent marking points then follow
      through marks should be awarded. When marking, indicate this by adding ECF (error carried forward) on the script. “Allow ECF” will be displayed in
      the “Notes” column.
13.   Do not penalize candidates for errors in units or significant figures, unless it is specifically referred to in the “Notes” column.
14.   Allow reasonable substitutions where in common usage, eg c for rad.
                                                                                    –4–                                  N22/4/PHYSI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M



     Question                                           Answers                                                       Notes                     Total
1.     a         g OR 9.81 «m s-2» OR acceleration of gravity/due to free fall                 Accept 10 «m s-2».                               1
                                                                                                Ignore sign.
                                                                                                Do not accept bald “gravity”.
                                                                                                Accept answer that indicates tangent of the
                                                                                                graph at time t=0.

1      b         Identification of air resistance/drag force «acting upwards»                  A statement as “air resistance increases with    3
                                                                                                speed” scores MP1 and MP2.
                 «that» increases with speed 

                 «until» weight and air resistance cancel out
                 OR
                 net force/acceleration becomes zero 


1      c    i    «loss in» GPE =3.4 × 10 −5 × 9.81 × 21=« 7.0 × 10 −3 » «J»                     Allow [1] through the use of kinematics          3
                                                                                                assuming constant acceleration.
                 OR                                                                             Allow ECF from MP1
                 «gain in» KE = 0.5 × 3.4 × 10 −5 × 9.02 «= 1.4 × 10 −3 » «J» 

                 energy transferred to air «= 7.0 × 10 −3 − 1.4 × 10 −3 » = 5.6 × 10 −3 «J» 


                 any calculated answer to 2 sf        


1      c    ii   «gravitational» potential energy «of the raindrop» into thermal/internal Accept heat for thermal energy                         1
                 energy «of the air» 
                                                                                          Accept into kinetic energy of air particles
                                                                                                Ignore sound energy

    Question                                     Answers                                                       Notes                           Total
2     b    i    can be liquefied                                                        Accept the converse argument.
                has intermolecular forces / potential energy 
                has atoms/molecules that are not point objects / take up volume                                                               1 max
                does not follow the ideal gas law «for all T and p» 
                collisions between particles are non-elastic 

2     b    ii   ALTERNATIVE 1                                                            MP2 in ALT 2 must come from expansion of air,
                                                                                         not from expansion of water.
                «constant p and V imply» nT = const 
                                                                                         Award [0] for an answer based on expansion of
                                                                                         water.
                T increases hence n decreases 
                                                                                         Award [1] max for an answer based on
                                                                                         convection currents.
                ALTERNATIVE 2                                                                                                                   2
                «constant p and n imply» V is proportional to T / air expands as it is
                heated 
                «original» air occupies a greater volume OR some air leaves through
                opening 

2     c         photovoltaic cells output electrical energy                             Accept any reasonable advantage arising from
                electrical is a more versatile form of energy                           the electrical output,.e.g., PV cells allow for the
                                                                                         use of a long list of appliances, PV owners can
                                                                                         sell excess power back to grid.
                                                                                                                                                2
                                                                                         Accept electrical energy can be stored.

                                                                                         Do not accept references to efficiency for MP2.

3     c    i      travelling waves transfer energy OR standing waves don’t                                                                       1 max

                  amplitude of oscillation varies along a standing wave OR is constant along a
                  travelling wave 

                  standing waves have nodes / antinodes OR travelling waves don’t 

                  points in an internodal region have same phase in standing waves OR different
                  phase in travelling waves
3     c    ii     ALTERNATIVE 1                                                                         Conclusion must be justified, award [0]    2

                  critical angle = 13° «from              1500 » 

                           340         

     Question                                        Answers                                                            Notes                  Total
4.     a        horizontal component of any length to the left                                       Ignore point of application.
                vertical component two squares long upwards                                          Award [1] max if arrowhead not
                E.g.                                                                                  present.



                                                                                                                                                2




4      b        ALTERNATIVE 1                                                                         Accept reference to centripetal or net
                                                                                                      force indistinctly.
                the net/centripetal force has constant magnitude 
                                                                                                      Allow reference to centripetal
                                                                                                      acceleration.
                the direction of the net/centripetal force constantly changes 

                this is achieved by «vector-» adding weight and the force from the rod
                OR
                the force from the rod is «vector» difference of the centripetal force and weight 
                                                                                                                                                3

                ALTERNATIVE 2

                at the top Frod = Fc - W 

                at the bottom, Frod = Fc + W 

                net F/Fc is constant so the force from the rod is different «hence is changing» 

     Question                                            Answers                                                     Notes                Total
6.     a        according to ∆E =∆mc 2 / identifies mass energy equivalence                       Accept protons and neutrons

                energy is released when nucleons come together / a nucleus is formed «so
                nucleus has less mass than individual nucleons»                                                                             2
                OR
                energy is required to «completely» separate the nucleons / break apart a nucleus
                «so individual nucleons have more mass than nucleus» 

6      b    i   (m polonium   − mlead − mα ) c 2 OR ( 209.93676 − 205.92945 − 4.00151)             Allow ECF from MP1
                                                                                                   Award [2] for a BCA
                OR
                mass difference = 5.8x10-3                                                        Award [1] for 8.6 x 10-13 J              2

                conversion to MeV using 931.5 to give 5.4 «MeV» 
                                                                           – 12 –           N22/4/PHYSI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


    Question                                         Answers                                Notes                Total
6     b    ii   ALTERNATIVE 1
                                                                    Eα     pα2 / 2mα
                energy ratio expressed in terms of momentum, e.g.       = 2             
                                                                   Elead plead / 2mlead
                                   Eα    m
                pα = plead hence        = lead 
                                  Elead   mα
                mlead 206
                            = 51.5 ⇒ Eα = 51.5Elead «so α has a much greater KE»
                 mα       4
                OR
                mlead «much» greater than malpha «so α has a much greater KE» 
                                                                                                                   3

                ALTERNATIVE 2

                alpha particle and lead particle have equal and opposite momenta 

                so their velocities are inversely proportional to mass 

                but KE ∝ v2 «so α has a much greater KE» 
                                                                      – 13 –                                     N22/4/PHYSI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M



    Question                                        Answers                                                      Notes                      Total
6     b    iii   photon energy is determined by its wavelength 

                 photons are emitted when nucleus undergoes transitions between its «nuclear»
                 energy levels
                 OR
                 photon energy equals the difference between «nuclear» energy levels 
                                                                                                                                             3

                 photons have the same energy / a fixed value
                 OR
                 energy is quantized / discrete 

    Question                                                 Answers                                                              Notes           Total
8     a         potential greater at Y 

                              ∆Ve
                «from E = −       » the potential increases in the direction opposite to field strength «so from
                              ∆r
                X to Y»
                OR                                                                                                                                  2
                opposite to the direction of the field lines, «so from X to Y»
                OR
                «from W = q ∆Ve » work done to move a positive charge from X to Y is positive «so the
                potential increases from X to Y» 

                KE = × 8.0 × 102 ×                               OR 2.3 × 1010 «J»                                                                 2
                                                       6                                                              (KE = 2.5x1010 J)
                       2                      6.9 × 10

                                                                                                  = «3.6 × 109 J» 

                energy needed = KE + ∆PE = 2.7 × 10 «J» 

9.     a          1
                 « × 1.5 × 10−10 × 242 =
                                       » 4.3 × 10−8 «J»                                                                                    1
                  2

9      b    i                  A                                                                   Award [1] max for a reasoning without
                 «from C = ε     » capacitance decreases «by factor 4 / to 3.8 x 10-11 F»         numbers.
                               d
                             q                                                                                                              2
                 «from V =     » charge unchanged hence p.d. increases by factor 4 / to 96 «V» 
                             C

9      b    ii   work = (energy in the new arrangement) − (initial energy)                        Allow ECF from 9(a)
                                                                                                   Award [2] for a BCA
                 «energy increased by factor 4 hence» work =3 × 4.3 × 10−8 =1.3 × 10−7 «J»                                                 2



9      c    i    exponential decrease from current = I0                                           For MP2, the curve should be between
                                                                                                   0.30 and 0.45 when time t = τ and
                 approximately correct values for time = τ AND 2τ                                 below 0.20 when time t = 2τ

                                                                         – 18 –                                        N22/4/PHYSI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


    Question                                         Answers                                                           Notes                     Total
9     c    ii   «activity vs time in» radioactive decay                                               Accept any other appropriate physics
                                                                                                      phenomenon, as X-ray absorption.
                OR
                                                                                                      Accept terminal velocity as the question
                                                                                                      can be interpreted as a phenomenon          1
                thermal energy transfer 
                                                                                                      modelled with an exponential function
                                                                                                      (i.e. including growth).
                                                                                                      Do not accept dice throwing.

9     d         without a capacitor, output voltage/current drops to zero «twice per cycle of input
                voltage» 

                capacitor provides smoothing / smooths out voltage/current variations 
                                                                                                                                                 2 max
                voltage/current output becomes constant / similar to direct current output 

                voltage/current does not drop to zero 
                by returning some of its energy/charge to the circuit «when input voltage is low» 
                                                                             – 19 –                             N22/4/PHYSI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                                      Answers                                              Notes            Total
10.    a    i    strong «nuclear» force                                                                                                  1

10     a    ii   ALTERNATIVE 1

                 attempt to apply conservation law of baryon number to the overall reaction 
                 baryon number of X is zero 
                 this is only possible if constituent quarks of X have an opposite baryon number  «so quark-
                 antiquark pair»

                 ALTERNATIVE 2

                 attempt to apply conservation law of charge to the overall reaction 
                 charge of X is −1 
                                                                                   2     1                                                3
                 this is only possible is constituent quarks of X have charges of - and - 
                                                                                   3     3
                 «so quark-antiquark pair»

                 ALTERNATIVE 3

                 attempt to apply conservation law of baryon number OR charge to each vertex 
                                                                   1                 1
                 at first vertex, the unknown particle has charge - OR baryon number   hence a quark 
                                                                   3                 3
                                                                     2                   1
                 at second vertex, the unknown particle has charge - OR baryon number - hence an antiquark 
                                                                     3                   3

10     b         108 x 1.6x10-19 OR 1.6x10-11 seen                                                             Award [2] for a BCA
                           6.63 × 10 −34                                                                        Award [1] for an
                 ∆t ≅                          = 3 × 10−24 «s» 
                      4π × 108 × 1.60 × 10 −19                                                                  answer of 5.3x10-43 s.    2
                                                                                                                Allow ECF from MP1
